content.question: Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.) The work shown is The Milkmaid, painted by Johannes Vermeer circa 1658 C.E. Describe at least two visual characteristics of the work. Using specific visual evidence, explain how at least two visual characteristics contribute to a harmonious mood. Explain how The Milkmaid exemplifies genre painting in seventeenth-century northern Europe.

Describe at least two visual characteristics of the work. Using specific visual evidence, explain how at least two visual characteristics contribute to a harmonious mood. Explain how The Milkmaid exemplifies genre painting in seventeenth-century northern Europe.

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.3: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Explain how a specific work of art (or group of related works of art) demonstrates continuity and/or change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice.
